articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: What will come next remains unclear in the absence of a comprehensive agreement on the postwar future of Gaza, and although the stated aim of the ceasefire is to end the war entirely, it could easily unravel.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire and hostage release set to begin

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammed Salem
articles.description: Thousands of Palestinians burst into the streets across Gaza as a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas began on Sunday, some in celebration, others to visit the graves of relatives, while many rushed back to their homes.
articles.title: Gazans cheer as ceasefire between Israel and Hamas kicks off

articles.author: Steve Holland, Tim Reid
articles.description: Trump's "Make America Great Again Victory Rally" marks his first major speech in Washington since he urged his supporters to march on the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, in protest against his defeat.
articles.title: Trump holds victory rally in Washington ahead of inauguration

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: Even if temporary, the unprecedented shutdown of TikTok will have an impact on U.S.-China relations, domestic politics, the social-media marketplace and millions of Americans who depend on the app.
articles.title: TikTok goes dark for US users; Trump signals intervention

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas said on Sunday it would release three Israeli female hostages as part of the first phase of its ceasefire deal with Israel.
articles.title: Who are the Israeli hostages being released by Hamas on Sunday?

articles.author: Jonathan Spicer, Tuvan Gumrukcu, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Negotiations could set the stage for an accord in the coming months that would see some Kurdish fighters leave Syria's restive northeast and others brought under the authority of the new defense ministry.
articles.title: Negotiators zero in on potential deal to disarm Syria's last battleground

articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Syria's new defence minister said on Sunday it would not be right for U.S.-backed Kurdish fighters based in the country's northeast to retain their own bloc within the broader integrated Syrian armed forces.
articles.title: Syrian defence minister rejects Kurdish proposal for its own military bloc

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: A South Korean court granted on Sunday an extension of President Yoon Suk Yeol's detention, saying there was "concern" that Yoon could "destroy evidence" in a criminal probe related to his short-lived declaration of martial law in early December.
articles.title: South Korean court extends President Yoon's detention

articles.author: Ahmed Eljechtimi
articles.description: Four Moroccan truck drivers went missing on Saturday as they crossed the restive border area between Burkina Faso and Niger, a source from the Moroccan embassy in Burkina Faso and a Moroccan transport union said.
articles.title: Four Moroccan truck drivers disappear on Burkina-Niger border

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Eric Cox
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump's incoming administration is reconsidering plans for immigration raids in Chicago next week after details were leaked, Trump's “border czar” Tom Homan told the Washington Post in an interview on Saturday.
articles.title: Trump rethinking next week's planned immigration raids, report says
